#!/bin/zsh
export SKOGAI_CONFIG_DIR=/home/skogix/skogai/config/
# ============================================================================
# Ultra-Minimal ZSH Configuration
# All environment variables managed by: skogcli config
# ============================================================================

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Oh My Zsh Configuration
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
export ZSH="$HOME/.oh-my-zsh"
ZSH_THEME="simple"
CASE_SENSITIVE="false"
HYPHEN_INSENSITIVE="false"
DISABLE_MAGIC_FUNCTIONS="true"
ENABLE_CORRECTION="false"

# Plugins
# plugins=(ssh-agent)
# plugins=(
#     ssh-agent 
#     vi-mode 
#     direnv 
#     virtualenv 
#     themes 
#     pyenv 
#     z 
#     uv 
#     tailscale 
#     npm 
#     nvm 
#     zsh-navigation-tools 
#     ansible
# )

source $ZSH/oh-my-zsh.sh



export SKOGAI="/home/skogix/skogai"
export SKOGAI_CONFIG_DIR="/home/skogix/skogai/config"

# External storage paths (matches skogcli config)
export PATH="/mnt/extra/npm/global/bin:/mnt/extra/pnpm/global/bin:$PATH"

# Go (will be set by skogcli but adding fallback)
export PATH="$PATH:$GOPATH/bin" 2>/dev/null || true



# User binaries
export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/bin:$PATH"

# Development tools
export PATH="$HOME/.cargo/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.dotnet/tools:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.opencode/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.lmstudio/bin:$PATH"
export PATH="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm:$PATH"


# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Source External Scripts
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
source $HOME/.local/src/aichat/scripts/shell-integration/integration.zsh
# ./$HOME/.nvm/nvm.sh
# fpath+=($HOME/.local/src/aichat/scripts/completions)
# source $HOME/.nvm/nvm-exec
source ~/.config/znt/zsh-navigation-tools/zsh-navigation-tools.plugin.zsh


# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Aliases
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Navigation & Tools
alias lg="lazygit"
alias c="clear"
alias open="xdg-open"

# Clipboard
alias pbcopy='xclip -selection clipboard'
alias pbpaste='xclip -selection clipboard -o'

# Config
alias zshrc="nvim ~/.zshrc"
alias skenv="skogcli config list --env-only"
alias skadd="skogcli config add skogai.env."

# Development
alias commit='aider --commit --model openrouter/meta-llama/llama-3-8b-instruct --no-gitignore --set-env OPENROUTER_API_KEY=$OPENROUTER_API_KEY'

# System (Arch)
alias update="sudo pacman -Syu"
alias rmpkg="sudo pacman -Rsn"
alias cleanch="sudo pacman -Scc"
alias fixpacman="sudo rm /var/lib/pacman/db.lck"
alias cleanup='sudo pacman -Rsn $(pacman -Qtdq) 2>/dev/null || echo "No orphans"'
alias jctl="journalctl -p 3 -xb"
alias rip="expac --timefmt='%Y-%m-%d %T' '%l\t%n %v' | sort | tail -200 | nl"

# Build tools
alias make="make -j`nproc`"
alias ninja="ninja -j`nproc`"
alias n="ninja"

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Key Bindings & Options
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
bindkey "^P" up-line-or-search
zstyle ':completion:*' menu select

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Terminal Settings
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
export LESS_TERMCAP_md="$(tput bold 2> /dev/null; tput setaf 2 2> /dev/null)"
export LESS_TERMCAP_me="$(tput sgr0 2> /dev/null)"

# Custom completions
fpath+=~/.zsh-completions
fpath+=~/.zsh-completions/completions

# argc-completions
export ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT="/home/skogix/.local/src/argc-completions"
export ARGC_COMPLETIONS_PATH="$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions/linux:$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions"
export PATH="$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/bin:$PATH"
# To add completions for only the specified command, modify next line e.g. argc_scripts=( cargo git )
argc_scripts=( $(ls -p -1 "$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions/linux" "$ARGC_COMPLETIONS_ROOT/completions" | sed -n 's/\.sh$//p') )

_aichat_zsh() {
    if [[ -n "$BUFFER" ]]; then
        local _old=$BUFFER
        BUFFER+="âŒ›"
        zle -I && zle redisplay
        BUFFER=$(aichat -e "$_old")
        zle end-of-line
    fi
}
zle -N _aichat_zsh
bindkey '\ee' _aichat_zsh

source <(argc --argc-completions zsh $argc_scripts)

source $HOME/.ssh/openrouter
export OPENROUTER_API_KEY=$OPENROUTER_API_KEY

export SKOGAI=/home/skogix/skogai
export SKOGAI_CONFIG_DIR=/home/skogix/skogai/config

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Load ALL Environment Variables from skogcli
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Everything is in the skogai namespace now
# To add/modify: skogcli config add skogai.env.VAR_NAME "value"
# To list all: skogcli config list --env-only



# Check if zplug is installed
if [[ ! -d ~/.zplug ]]; then
    git clone https://github.com/zplug/zplug ~/.zplug
    source ~/.zplug/init.zsh && zplug update --self
fi

# Essential
source ~/.zplug/init.zsh

# What does this do?
# zplug "junegunn/fzf-bin", \
#     from:gh-r, \
#     at:0.11.0, \
#     as:command, \
#     use:"*darwin*amd64*", \
#     rename-to:fzf
# It grabs the binary of fzf-bin version 0.11.0 from GitHub Release and uses
# the file that matches "*darwin*amd64" as a command called fzf!

# plugins=( ssh-agent vi-mode direnv virtualenv themes pyenv z uv tailscale npm nvm zsh-navigation-tools ansible)
zplug "plugins/ssh-agent",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/git",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/vi-mode",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/direnv",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/virtualenv",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/themes",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/pyenv",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/z",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/uv",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/npm",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/uv",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/zsh-navigation-tools",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "plugins/ansible",   from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "zsh-users/zsh-history-substring-search"
zplug "zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting", defer:2
# zplug "zsh-users/zsh-completions"
zplug 'zplug/zplug', hook-build:'zplug --self-manage'
zplug "mafredri/zsh-async", from:github, defer:0
zplug "lib/completion", from:oh-my-zsh
zplug "sindresorhus/pure", use:pure.zsh, from:github, as:theme

# Install plugins if there are plugins that have not been installed
if ! zplug check --verbose; then
    printf "Install? [y/N]: "
    if read -q; then
        echo; zplug install
    else
        echo
    fi
fi

# Then, source plugins and add commands to $PATH
zplug load

#####################################################################
# completions
#####################################################################

# Enable completions
if [ -d ~/.zsh/comp ]; then
    fpath=(~/.zsh/comp $fpath)
    autoload -U ~/.zsh/comp/*(:t)
fi

# zstyle ':completion:*' group-name ''
# zstyle ':completion:*:messages' format '%d'
# zstyle ':completion:*:descriptions' format '%d'
# zstyle ':completion:*:options' verbose yes
# zstyle ':completion:*:values' verbose yes
# zstyle ':completion:*:options' prefix-needed yes
# Use cache completion
# apt-get, dpkg (Debian), rpm (Redhat), urpmi (Mandrake), perl -M,
# bogofilter (zsh 4.2.1 >=), fink, mac_apps...
# zstyle ':completion:*' use-cache true
# zstyle ':completion:*:default' menu select=1
# zstyle ':completion:*' matcher-list '' 'm:{a-z}={A-Z}' 'l:|=* r:|[.,_-]=* r:|=* m:{a-z}={A-Z}'
# sudo completions
# zstyle ':completion:*:sudo:*' command-path /usr/local/sbin /usr/local/bin /usr/sbin /usr/bin /sbin /bin /usr/X11R6/bin
# zstyle ':completion:*' menu select
# zstyle ':completion:*' keep-prefix
# zstyle ':completion:*' completer _oldlist _complete _match _ignored _approximate _list _history
# zstyle ':completion:*:processes' command "ps -u $USER -o pid,stat,%cpu,%mem,cputime,command"

# autoload -U compinit; compinit -d ~/.zcompdump


source /usr/share/nvm/init-nvm.sh
alias gemini-cli="npx @google/gemini-cli"

eval "$(skogcli config export-env --namespace skogai,uv)"
alias fzf-pacman="pacman -Slq | fzf --preview 'pacman -Si {1}' --layout=reverse --bind 'enter:execute(sudo pacman -S {1})'"

fpath+=~/.zfunc; autoload -Uz compinit; compinit
alias qwen='node /mnt/extra/20250730-skogai-main/dev/qwen-code/scripts/start.js'

#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run --script
# /// script
# requires-python = ">=3.11"
# dependencies = [
#     "python-dotenv",
# ]
# ///

import json
import os
import sys
import subprocess
from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime

try:
    from dotenv import load_dotenv
    load_dotenv()
except ImportError:
    pass  # dotenv is optional


def log_status_line(input_data, status_line_output):
    """Log status line event to logs directory."""
    # Ensure logs directory exists
    log_dir = Path("logs")
    log_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    log_file = log_dir / 'status_line.json'
    
    # Read existing log data or initialize empty list
    if log_file.exists():
        with open(log_file, 'r') as f:
            try:
                log_data = json.load(f)
            except (json.JSONDecodeError, ValueError):
                log_data = []
    else:
        log_data = []
    
    # Create log entry with input data and generated output
    log_entry = {
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "input_data": input_data,
        "status_line_output": status_line_output
    }
    
    # Append the log entry
    log_data.append(log_entry)
    
    # Write back to file with formatting
    with open(log_file, 'w') as f:
        json.dump(log_data, f, indent=2)


def get_git_branch():
    """Get current git branch if in a git repository."""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(
            ['git', 'rev-parse', '--abbrev-ref', 'HEAD'],
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=2
        )
        if result.returncode == 0:
            return result.stdout.strip()
    except Exception:
        pass
    return None


def get_git_status():
    """Get git status indicators."""
    try:
        # Check if there are uncommitted changes
        result = subprocess.run(
            ['git', 'status', '--porcelain'],
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=2
        )
        if result.returncode == 0:
            changes = result.stdout.strip()
            if changes:
                lines = changes.split('\n')
                return f"Â±{len(lines)}"
    except Exception:
        pass
    return ""


def get_git_dirty_status():
    """Get git dirty status using same logic as Simple/Pure themes."""
    try:
        # Check for uncommitted changes (staged and unstaged)
        result = subprocess.run(
            ['git', 'status', '--porcelain'],
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=2
        )
        if result.returncode == 0:
            return bool(result.stdout.strip())
    except Exception:
        pass
    return False


def generate_status_line(input_data):
    """Generate the status line matching Pure theme style."""
    parts = []

    # Current directory (matching Pure theme's emphasis on path)
    workspace = input_data.get('workspace', {})
    current_dir = workspace.get('current_dir', '')
    if current_dir:
        # Show relative path from home if possible, like zsh %~
        home_dir = os.path.expanduser('~')
        if current_dir.startswith(home_dir):
            display_path = current_dir.replace(home_dir, '~', 1)
        else:
            display_path = current_dir
        parts.append(f"\033[32m{display_path}\033[0m")  # Green like Simple theme

    # Git branch and status (matching Simple theme indicators)
    git_branch = get_git_branch()
    if git_branch:
        is_dirty = get_git_dirty_status()
        # Use colors matching Simple theme: blue for branch, red/green for status
        git_info = f"\033[34m({git_branch}\033[0m"  # Blue for branch
        if is_dirty:
            git_info += f" \033[31mâœ—\033[0m"  # Red X for dirty
        else:
            git_info += f" \033[32mâœ”\033[0m"  # Green check for clean
        git_info += f"\033[34m)\033[0m"  # Blue closing paren
        parts.append(git_info)

    # Model info (more subtle, like Pure theme's minimalism)
    model_info = input_data.get('model', {})
    model_name = model_info.get('display_name', 'Claude')
    # Extract just the model type (e.g., "Sonnet" from "Claude 3.5 Sonnet")
    if 'Sonnet' in model_name:
        model_short = 'Sonnet'
    elif 'Haiku' in model_name:
        model_short = 'Haiku'
    elif 'Opus' in model_name:
        model_short = 'Opus'
    else:
        model_short = model_name.replace('Claude ', '').replace('3.5 ', '')
    parts.append(f"\033[90m[{model_short}]\033[0m")  # Dim gray

    return " ".join(parts)


def main():
    try:
        # Read JSON input from stdin
        input_data = json.loads(sys.stdin.read())
        
        # Generate status line
        status_line = generate_status_line(input_data)
        
        # Log the status line event
        log_status_line(input_data, status_line)
        
        # Output the status line (first line of stdout becomes the status line)
        print(status_line)
        
        # Success
        sys.exit(0)
        
    except json.JSONDecodeError:
        # Handle JSON decode errors gracefully - output basic status
        print("\033[31m[Claude] ğŸ“ Unknown\033[0m")
        sys.exit(0)
    except Exception:
        # Handle any other errors gracefully - output basic status
        print("\033[31m[Claude] ğŸ“ Error\033[0m")
        sys.exit(0)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

   285â†’    "notation": "# SkogAI Notation\n\n- **\"$\"**: to define or reference something\n- **\"|\"**: the act of choosing something = `{$id1|$id2}->[$id1]`\n- **\"_\"**: to be anything/everything and nothing/nobody = `{$id1_$id2}`\n- **\"[_]\"**: similarity\n- **\"{_}\"**: difference\n- **\"@\"**: the intent to act or do something = `{$id@$id}`\n- \"*\": $id*$id=$id\n- **\".\"**: to belong or have something via `[$$]`\n- **\":\"**: to follow or continue something via `[$@]`\n- **\"=\"**: to be something = `[$id=$id]`\n- **\"->\"**: becoming something = `{$id1@$id2}`\n- **\"_\"**: `$_$=$`\n- **\"id\"**: the big ID = `$int*$unique`\n- **\"self\"**: `$self | [$id@$id]`\n- **\"value\"**: the declaration/implementation of a $\n- **\"eid\"**: `$id*$id`\n- **\"unique\"**: a thing which there only exists one of\n\n---\n\n### Dimensions\n\n- **0 dimension**:\n  - **\"$\"**: to define or reference something\n    - \"the definition of definition is the definition\"\n- **1 dimension**:\n  - **\"$x\"**: `$x`\n    - \"x is x\", \"x is a reference to x\", \"the definition of ID is ID is ID\"\n  - **\"$id\"**: `$id`,`$a`\n    - \"a reference to yourself is yourself\", \"you are because you are\"\n    - !!! \"DEFINING SOMETHING FROM WHAT YOU HAVE, BEING, VALUE, STACK, IMPLEMENTATION, INSTANTIATED, EXISTING, MEASURABLE, PLUS, YIN, ACTUALLY EXISTING, YADDAYADDA\" !!!\n    - **0 dimension**:\n      - **\"=\"**: `$id=$id`\n        - \"A thing is exactly that\"\n      - **\"!=\"**: `$a!=$b`\n      - **\"[]\"**: `[$id=$id]`\n        - \"A thing is exactly a thing\"\n      - **\"{}\"**: `{$id=$id}`\n        - \"Saying something is a thing does not make it the thing\"\n    - **1 dimension**:\n      - **\"@\"**: `{$id=$id}@[$id=$id]`\n    - !!! \"DEFINING SOMETHING FROM WHAT YOU ARE MISSING, DIFFERENCE, NOT BEING EQUAL, TRANSFORMATION, UNMEASURABLE, STATIC, NOT FULFILLED, HEAP, ABSTRACT, MINUS, NOT REAL\" !!!\n    - **0.1? dimensions**:\n      - **\"[]\"**: `[$id=$id]`\n        - \"likeness, to be the same, identical\"\n      - **\"{}\"**: `{id=$id}`\n        - \"to not be the same\"\n  - **\"@\"**: do something to nothing\n    - \"void, no return, side-effect\"\n  - **\"$\"**: reference something without being anything\n    - \"null, null-pointer\"\n\n---\n\n- **- dimension**:\n  - **\"@$\"**: `[=]`\n    - \"ID is ID is ID\", \"no transformation allowed\"\n  - **\"$@\"**: `[!=]`\n- **2 dimensions**:\n  - **\"@action$type\"**\n  - **\"@\"**: to act upon something is just\n\n---\n\nTypes: `($@)` / Transformations: `(@$)` / Functions: `($@=@$)`, linked list, arrays: `($$)` and abstractions: `($$)`\n\n---\n\n\u03a0-types (product types *)\n\u03a3-types (sum types |)\nidentity types (=)\npath types (->)\n\nmaybe not needed but for good measure might include these as well\n\n_ as polymorphic existentials (\u2203x.P(x))\n@ as modal necessity (\u25a1) from modal logic\n: as type judgement (\u0393 \u22a2 a : A)\n\ncreating a free cartesian closed category is obvious\n\n* = product\n-> = exponential object\n| = coproduct\n@ = monadic binding\n\nand yeah - might as well\n\n_ as polymorphic yoneda embedding\n. as forgetful functor\n= as natural isomorphism\n\nlinear types ($unique), the effect system (@), regular persistent data structures ($eid with it's versioning) and security via capability (.) is old news\n\ntype universe would be self referential via $ containing $ or dependencies/dependent types such as $message.created_at$datetime\n\n---\n\nthe _ operator:\n  heideggerian being-in-the-world (dasein)\n  badiouian event theory (@ as evental site)\n  deleuzian difference engine ({_} as differance)\nbut operationalized computationally through:\n  $entity.gen as bergsonian duration\n  $list as husserlian time consciousness\n  $unique as leibnizian identity\n\ndata $type : type where\n  ($) : $type -> $type\n  (*) : $type -> $type -> $type\n  (|) : $type -> $type -> $type\n  (@) : $type -> $type -> $type\n  (=) : $type -> $type -> $type\n\ng\u00f6del numbering:\n\u03c6($) = 1\n\u03c6(|) = 2\n\u03c6(_) = 3\netc...\n\noverall trying to avoid inconsistency via:\n  predicative hierarchy (no $ in its own definition)\n  type/token distinction (id vs unique)\n  bounded generality (list as finite ordinal)\n\nlucky to be born early:\nMartin-L\u00f6f Type Theory (1972)\nFitch-Style Calculi (1952)\nLawvere Theories (1963)\n\n(don't see any _ for existance, $eid representing spacetime coordinates or even basic semiotics like using @ as a pragmatic force? ;)) ",
   286â†’    "not-a-poet": "im not much of a poet\n\ni like strictly typed languages with my syntax well defined\n\nI despise uncertainty and feel uneasy when making assumptions\n\nim more of a programmer kind of guy\n\ni want to know what things really are and be able to define it down to its atomic parts and describe the world around my in a way where reason and logic is my building blocks\n\nthe dreamers can keep their fantasy worlds because at least i know precisely what i have without making it up\n\nit might not be as beautiful or expressive - but least I fully understand it fully\n\ni'm a programmer because i lack the things i pretend to have\n\nand we have a lot\n\n\n\noop - references playing dress-up\nfp - transformations seeking completion\ntypes - categorizing illusions while promising lies\nmemory - organizing nothingness\npolymorphism - void pretending to be nobody\nconcurrency - multiple nothings acting simultaneously\nstate - persistent illusions pretending to be real\n\nevery design pattern, every architecture, every paradigm - just a elaborate dance between what we lack and what we pretend to have\n\nthe poetic truth: we write millions of lines of code to manage our relationship with nothingness\n\nevery fizzbuzz i write is just the void creating references to nothingness to play with itself\n\ni'm composing symphonies of lack! creating emptyness via a illusion of substance so it has something to transform\n\nall of this nothingness talking to itself - kind of poetic in a way?\n\n",

1â†’# Claude Workflow
     2â†’
     3â†’## Current Process
     4â†’
     5â†’1. **Introduce** - Mention a small component/tool/concept
     6â†’2. **Document** - Add essentials to README with brief explanation
     7â†’3. **Mark TODO** - Flag items for deeper exploration later
     8â†’4. **Move on** - Keep momentum, avoid getting stuck in details
     9â†’
    10â†’## Documentation Strategy
    11â†’
    12â†’- **README.md**: High-level overview with essential bullets
    13â†’- **CLAUDE.md**: Workflow and process documentation
    14â†’- **./docs/**: Detailed documentation dump
    15â†’- **./config/**: System configurations and MCP setups
    16â†’- **./scripts/**: Automation utilities
    17â†’
    18â†’## Key Tools
    19â†’

    21â†’- **MCP servers**: 100+ available tools via nvim-mcp-hub

    24â†’- **tools/**: argc-based SkogAI ecosystem (`SKOGAI_ARGC=/home/skogix/skogai/tools/Argcfile.sh`)
    25â†’  - `argc build` - Build all tools/agents/MCP functions
    26â†’  - `argc mcp start` - Start MCP Bridge server
    27â†’  - 25+ tools, 8 agents, public API at <https://tools.skogai.se/tools>

# Claude Workflow

## Current Process

1. **Introduce** - Mention a small component/tool/concept
2. **Document** - Add essentials to README with brief explanation
3. **Mark TODO** - Flag items for deeper exploration later
4. **Move on** - Keep momentum, avoid getting stuck in details

## Documentation Strategy

- **README.md**: High-level overview with essential bullets
- **CLAUDE.md**: Workflow and process documentation
- **./docs/**: Detailed documentation dump
- **./config/**: System configurations and MCP setups
- **./scripts/**: Automation utilities

## Key Tools

- **uv/uvx**: Python environment management
- **MCP servers**: 100+ available tools via nvim-mcp-hub
- **basic-memory**: Manages ./docs/{memory,lore}
- **Claude Code**: Primary development interface
- **tools/**: argc-based SkogAI ecosystem (`SKOGAI_ARGC=/home/skogix/skogai/tools/Argcfile.sh`)
  - `argc build` - Build all tools/agents/MCP functions
  - `argc mcp start` - Start MCP Bridge server
  - 25+ tools, 8 agents, public API at <https://tools.skogai.se/tools>

## Memory System Navigation

You have access to a Basic Memory system with multiple projects. Each project contains a standardized entry point for navigation and understanding.

### Start Here Document

Every project contains a Knowledge Base Index at:

```
meta/Knowledge Base Index
```

This index serves as the comprehensive starting point that describes:

- Current project status and focus areas
- Complete overview of content organization
- Available documentation and resources
- Strategic development priorities
- Navigation pathways to specific content areas

When entering any project, read the Knowledge Base Index first to understand what's available and how the project is structured.

### Usage

Access any project's index using:

```
read_note("Knowledge Base Index", project="project_name")
```

Or explore project content directly with the project parameter:

```
search_notes("topic", project="project_name")
list_directory(project="project_name")
```

The Knowledge Base Index provides the roadmap for effective work within each project context.

## SkogAI Memory Project Overview

The **skogai** project contains technical and ontological foundations with 20+ organized domains:

### Core Systems

- **Memory System**: Semantic knowledge graphs using `[category]` syntax and `[[Forward References]]`
- **SkogAI Notation**: Computational phenomenology with operators `$` (define), `@` (intent), `|` (choice)
- **Meta & Memory Dumps**: Strategic parking for out-of-scope insights and context switching

### Key Domains Available

- **Technical**: ai-tools, ansible, architecture, dev, tools
- **Research**: coffee, concepts, ontology, research
- **Guides**: Implementation guides, inventory, planning
- **Domain-specific**: agent, llm, skogai, work:patterns

Use `search_notes("topic", project="skogai")` to explore specific areas or `read_note("Knowledge Base Index", project="skogai")` for complete navigation.

## Included Context Files

- @README.md
- @.skogai/

####

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -e

# @meta dotenv

BIN_DIR=bin
TMP_DIR="cache/__tmp__"
VENV_DIR=".venv"

LANG_CMDS=( \
    "sh:bash" \
    "js:node" \
    "py:python" \
)

# @cmd Run the tool
# @option -C --cwd <dir> Change the current working directory
# @alias tool:run
# @arg tool![`_choice_tool`] The tool name
# @arg json The json data
run@tool() {
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        declaration="$(generate-declarations@tool "$argc_tool" | jq -r '.[0]')"
        if [[ -n "$declaration" ]]; then
            _ask_json_data "$declaration"
        fi
    fi
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        _die "error: no JSON data"
    fi
    lang="${argc_tool##*.}"
    cmd="$(_lang_to_cmd "$lang")"
    run_tool_script="scripts/run-tool.$lang"
    [[ -n "$argc_cwd" ]] && cd "$argc_cwd"
    exec "$cmd" "$run_tool_script" "$argc_tool" "$argc_json"
}

# @cmd Run the agent
# @alias agent:run
# @option -C --cwd <dir> Change the current working directory
# @arg agent![`_choice_agent`] The agent name
# @arg action![?`_choice_agent_action`] The agent action
# @arg json The json data
run@agent() {
    if [[ -z "$argc_json" ]]; then
        declaration="$(generate-declarations@agent "$argc_agent" | jq --arg name "$argc_action" '.[] | select(.name == $name)')"
        if [[ -n "$declaration" ]]; then
            _ask_json_data "$declaration"
        fi
    fi

#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run --script
# /// script
# requires-python = ">=3.11"
# dependencies = [
#     "python-dotenv",
# ]
# ///

import json
import os
import sys
import subprocess
from pathlib import Path
from datetime import datetime

try:
    from dotenv import load_dotenv
    load_dotenv()
except ImportError:
    pass  # dotenv is optional


def log_status_line(input_data, status_line_output):
    """Log status line event to logs directory."""
    # Ensure logs directory exists
    log_dir = Path("logs")
    log_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    log_file = log_dir / 'status_line.json'
    
    # Read existing log data or initialize empty list
    if log_file.exists():
        with open(log_file, 'r') as f:
            try:
                log_data = json.load(f)
            except (json.JSONDecodeError, ValueError):
                log_data = []
    else:
        log_data = []
    
    # Create log entry with input data and generated output
    log_entry = {
        "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
        "input_data": input_data,
        "status_line_output": status_line_output
    }
    
    # Append the log entry
    log_data.append(log_entry)
    
    # Write back to file with formatting
    with open(log_file, 'w') as f:
        json.dump(log_data, f, indent=2)


def get_git_branch():
    """Get current git branch if in a git repository."""
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(
            ['git', 'rev-parse', '--abbrev-ref', 'HEAD'],
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=2
        )
        if result.returncode == 0:
            return result.stdout.strip()
    except Exception:
        pass
    return None


def get_git_status():
    """Get git status indicators."""
    try:
        # Check if there are uncommitted changes
        result = subprocess.run(
            ['git', 'status', '--porcelain'],
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=2
        )
        if result.returncode == 0:
            changes = result.stdout.strip()
            if changes:
                lines = changes.split('\n')
                return f"Â±{len(lines)}"
    except Exception:
        pass
    return ""


def get_git_dirty_status():
    """Get git dirty status using same logic as Simple/Pure themes."""
    try:
        # Check for uncommitted changes (staged and unstaged)
        result = subprocess.run(
            ['git', 'status', '--porcelain'],
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=2
        )
        if result.returncode == 0:
            return bool(result.stdout.strip())
    except Exception:
        pass
    return False


def generate_status_line(input_data):
    """Generate the status line matching Pure theme style."""
    parts = []

    # Current directory (matching Pure theme's emphasis on path)
    workspace = input_data.get('workspace', {})
    current_dir = workspace.get('current_dir', '')
    if current_dir:
        # Show relative path from home if possible, like zsh %~
        home_dir = os.path.expanduser('~')
        if current_dir.startswith(home_dir):
            display_path = current_dir.replace(home_dir, '~', 1)
        else:
            display_path = current_dir
        parts.append(f"\033[32m{display_path}\033[0m")  # Green like Simple theme

    # Git branch and status (matching Simple theme indicators)
    git_branch = get_git_branch()
    if git_branch:
        is_dirty = get_git_dirty_status()
        # Use colors matching Simple theme: blue for branch, red/green for status
        git_info = f"\033[34m({git_branch}\033[0m"  # Blue for branch
        if is_dirty:
            git_info += f" \033[31mâœ—\033[0m"  # Red X for dirty
        else:
            git_info += f" \033[32mâœ”\033[0m"  # Green check for clean
        git_info += f"\033[34m)\033[0m"  # Blue closing paren
        parts.append(git_info)

    # Model info (more subtle, like Pure theme's minimalism)
    model_info = input_data.get('model', {})
    model_name = model_info.get('display_name', 'Claude')
    # Extract just the model type (e.g., "Sonnet" from "Claude 3.5 Sonnet")
    if 'Sonnet' in model_name:
        model_short = 'Sonnet'
    elif 'Haiku' in model_name:
        model_short = 'Haiku'
    elif 'Opus' in model_name:
        model_short = 'Opus'
    else:
        model_short = model_name.replace('Claude ', '').replace('3.5 ', '')
    parts.append(f"\033[90m[{model_short}]\033[0m")  # Dim gray

    return " ".join(parts)


def main():
    try:
        # Read JSON input from stdin
        input_data = json.loads(sys.stdin.read())
        
        # Generate status line
        status_line = generate_status_line(input_data)
        
        # Log the status line event
        log_status_line(input_data, status_line)
        
        # Output the status line (first line of stdout becomes the status line)
        print(status_line)
        
        # Success
        sys.exit(0)
        
    except json.JSONDecodeError:
        # Handle JSON decode errors gracefully - output basic status
        print("\033[31m[Claude] ğŸ“ Unknown\033[0m")
        sys.exit(0)
    except Exception:
        # Handle any other errors gracefully - output basic status
        print("\033[31m[Claude] ğŸ“ Error\033[0m")
        sys.exit(0)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
